head.supplied: 28/10/81. ¶ ¶ This day, dear Mr Morrah, I received the byefollowing letter from the Inspector of Forests, Adelaide. ¶ Would you be so kind to provide a short memorandum on the question raised by him...

div.p: G14362, unit 20, VPRS 619 Secretary's Correspondence Files, Alphabetical System, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

This day, dear Mr Morrah, I received the byefollowing letter from the Inspector of Forests, Adelaide.
See J. Ednie Brown to M, 24 October 1881 (in this edition as 81-10-24a). Would you be so kind to provide a short memorandum on the question raised by him?

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
The Secretary of Lands forwarded the letter to the Railways Department, which could not provide the information.
